text: <@U1V9UML9E> <@U0YQQRNU8>  Is there anything about STL endpoint registry need todo? If there is, I'd like to volunteer myself to do that.

Hi <@U1ZUSJHAA> we ended up changing the design of endpoint registry just a little bit.  Instead of connection and authorization in the same place we split it into two.  Endpoint Registry continues as a source for connectivity information whereas the authorization record is in a new place called Validator Registry.
<https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/blob/master/validator/journal/consensus/poet1/validator_registry.py>

The tests may be incomplete so that's one thing to think about.  
<https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/blob/master/validator/tests/unit/test_validator_registry.py>

text: <@U1ZUSJHAA> there's an aspect that hasn't been built out yet.  Mic had initially prototyped a way to use the validator registry with a whitelist.  Essentially the administrator could provide a list of validator public keys that were trusted.  I can try to describe in more detail if that's of interest to you.
